summary: In 2018 alone, there were 14 separate billion-dollar weather and climate disasters in the United States, with a total cost of at least $91 billion. These costs will likely rise due to climate change. Investing in climate resilience projects to help communities prepare for hazards such as sea level rise could reduce future costs. title: Climate Resilience: A Strategic Investment Approach for High-Priority Projects Could Help Target Federal Resources
